Just offshore in Mechanicville, three hours north of New York City, barges shuttle back and forth across the Champlain Canal, a waterway linked to the Hudson River.

The good news is we're finishing the dredging, and then we anticipate, over a decade or decades, that the fish advisories will begin to be reduced.
PCBs were once a key ingredient in GE's manufacturing of electrical components, but the substance has been linked to cancer in animals, and studies have shown severe impacts on wildlife.
PCBs were banned in the 1970s, but not before GE poured tons of it here in these waterways.

The Hudson became a symbol for sick and polluted rivers nationwide.
